intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion intermedium, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces yellow flowers in a single head, which are surrounded by a series of bracts. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it is characterized by its flowering structure and its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
